answers.answer: Pretty good from what I know. Your baby may have to stay in the hospital a little longer though. Do you know how much he or she weighs?

Your chances of baby surviving are pretty high I actually have a friend who had to give birth at 26 weeks due to preeclampsia her baby weighed 1 lb 9 oz and now she is a healthy 8 lb 4 month old your baby might have to stay in the nicu for a little while but she should be able to come home after a little while
She should be perfectly fine. Nicu for a few weeks until she learns to breathe and eat on her own and usually they have to weigh 5 pounds to leave nicu too.
They are really good, my Dr is trying to get me to 34 because the chance of survival increase dramatically
she weighed 3 lbs && 12 oz 4 weeks ago.a week over weight so.&& they gave her the steroids for.her.lungs.

My doctors plan to induce me at 34 or 35 weeks because my baby has a growth restrictions and other problems so your baby will be fine 37 weeks is considered full term so it's not too early plus I was born 2 and a half months early and am fine don't stress your baby will just be smaller and shouldn't have too long of a nicu stay

Chances of survival are pretty much the same as if u were full term , my friend had her baby at 32 weeks and she was breathing on her own , everything was fine she was just little so dnt  worry wif the technology they hve theses days and bubs are pretty resilient:-)

Survival RatesBabies born at 23 weeks have a 17% chance of survivalBabies born at 24 weeks have a 39% chance of survivalBabies born at 25 weeks have a 50% chance of survivalFrom 32 weeks onwards, most babies are able to survive with the help of medical Technologyhttp://www.preemiesurvival.org/info/
My sister had my nephew at 36weeks and he is perfectly fine. I know someone who gave birth at 25 weeks weighing 1lb4oz and yes he was in the hospital for awhile but he is doing great and healthy
